subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Utter/Ado
msgSnippet: ... . ... In practical application using Ing for all cases of It+Ing has become the norm for me, and looking back on the correspondence of the 60 s and 70 s,
messageBody:
On 24/11/2007, Anthony Grahn <othermale@...> wrote:


The rule: "use plain Ing for all cases everywhere of It+Ing and Eat+Ing"
Is a proposal. It directly contradicts the QM but I too think it is
worth considering as it seems to solve a few problems.

Similarly the rule: "use plain Ing for Ing+Gay" Is a proposal not seen
in the QM.


 
.
 
In practical application using Ing for all cases of It+Ing has become the norm for me, and looking back on the correspondence of the 60's and 70's, it had become the norm then.  So I think you can be assured that KR approved.
 
You must bear in mind that QM was never revised to incorporate the experience of the writing circle of that time.  Had it been so, I am sure that there would have been at least a few such amendments.  So, while I do take QM as being the bible, I also don't believe that the world was created in seven days!
_,_._,___
Moira
